metadata.Title: CVE-2018-7175 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - negligible
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in xpdf 4.00. A NULL pointer dereference inreadCodestream allows an attacker to cause denial of service via a JPXimage with zero components.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-7175` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.9
libpoppler-cpp0 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.9
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.9
libpoppler-qt4-4 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.9
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.9
libpoppler44 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.9
poppler-utils - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xpdf: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
poppler package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.24.5-2ubuntu4.9').
ipe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
